alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 28 at 11:40AM PST until January 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 7000 feet. Storm total snow accumulations above 7000 feet of 6 to 18 inches possible, except 1 to 3 feet between 8000-9000 feet. Areas above 9000 feet in elevation may see 4 to 6 feet. Winds gusting to 45 mph with ridgetops gusting up to 100 mph. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow totals of 1 to 5 inches below 6500 feet will be possible (including the cities of Bridgeport and Lee Vining), mainly Saturday night into early Sunday as snow levels drop.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
